thread.title: Delays to Isle of Wight Red Funnel car ferry service
thread.title_full: Delays to Isle of Wight Red Funnel car ferry service

author: Alex Cooper
title: Delays to Isle of Wight Red Funnel car ferry service
text:
There are delays on an Isle of Wight ferry service this afternoon (Thursday, January 30).
Passengers have told the County Press the delays are due to a medical emergency.
The 3pm Red Funnel ferry service from Southampton has been delayed.
It is understood the 3pm service is still at the mainland terminal.
The 4.30pm service from Southampton is also delayed as a result of the emergency.
The County Press has contacted Red Funnel for a statement.
Update (4.57pm): The 6pm and 7.30pm services from Southampton have been delayed by approximately 90 minutes due to the earlier onboard medical incident.
The 6pm sailing from East Cowes has been delayed by 45 minutes.
A spokesperson for Red Funnel said: “Our team, together with emergency services, is currently attending to a medical incident involving a passenger on board Red Eagle.
"The vessel was originally scheduled to depart Southampton at 15:00.
"As soon as emergency services are able to safely transfer the passenger off the vessel, we will be able to resume services, including enabling Red Osprey, which departed East Cowes at 15:00, to berth at our Southampton terminal.
"We anticipate some impact to our service schedule and appreciate the patience of our customers as we do our best return to timetable as soon as possible.
"We advise customers to check our live service status at www.redfunnel.co.uk/servicestatus for further updates.
"We thank our passengers for their understanding and apologise for any inconvenience.”
